bug.short_desc: info file entries not installed in dir
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I've just installed fedora 24 and added lots of packages to the base install. One of the packages I installed was emacs.
I see the file /usr/share/info/emacs.info.gz does exist, but there is no entry for it in the /usr/share/info/dir directory.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): emacs-common-25.0.94-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: 100%
Steps to Reproduce: 1.install emacs from f24 repos 2.try to run info on emacs 3.no entry in directory
Actual results: no info directory entry
Expected results: info directory gets updated
Additional info:

I see this, too. I wanted to access the Elisp reference manual in Info, but it is not listed in the top level Info directory node, even though it exists in the standard location in /usr/share/info.
As Tom Horsley, I cannot see the Emacs manual in the Info directory either.
Could you please try with https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a54ea177cf? My info pages are fine...
I just tried it on a virtual machine - no change. Still no entries made in the info directory file.
No change. I still cannot access many Info nodes from the top Info directory. But they all exist in the standard location -- /usr/share/info
emacs-25.0.95-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a6525ed529

emacs-25.0.95-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a6525ed529
On a first pass with the latest update in testing, emacs-25.0.95-2.fc24, I can access the Info nodes that were previously inaccessible. The issue seems to have been fixed so far.
emacs-25.0.95-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
